ygData.subject: Heritrix/harvesting open conference call, Wednesday May 28 1500GMT

Subject: Heritrix/harvesting open conference call, Wednesday May 28 1500GMT
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=VZEylLPu5dI-JBT6UqqOmnVtPaR683VTsUm8EGAiO0qa
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

We're trying something new next week -- an open-to-all conference call 
to improve communication among the Heritrix-using web harvesting community.

If all goes well, other calls will follow -- after each major Heritrix 
release, and perhaps more often. We will also work to have calls in 
pairs, so that there are times convenient for both European and Pacific 
timezones.

The first call will occur via a 'Skypecast', at the following time:

1500GMT Wednesday May 28th
   (8a San Francisco / 11a WashingtonDC / 4p London)

The call will open with a brief overview of what's new in the latest 
Heritrix releases (1.14.0 and 2.0.0), and some of the priorities for 
future releases. Then, it will be an open discussion of whatever 
participants want to talk about.

Participating in the Skypecast only requires a current version of Skype 
to participate, and accommodates up to 100 participants (with facilities 
for the moderator to rotate people into speaking positions).

Everyone using or interested in web harvesting with Heritrix is welcome 
to participate. Latest info, including a link to the Skypecast page 
which allows joining the call, will live at this Heritrix wiki page:

   http://webteam.archive.org/confluence/display/Heritrix/Community+Calls

Join us!

- Gordon @ IA
